span.a: You are currently on this page - COVID-19 Information

p.span: Contact helpdesk@huhs.org for any computer/connectivity issues.

p.b: *All staff are available via appointment as well.
Reach out to any of the following community resources whenever needed.
Dial 2-1-1 to access local family, health, and social service resources
Washington County Crisis Intervention Team: Call 262-365-6565
Crisis Text Line: Text HOME to 741741
Links below to the Centers for Disease Control information about COVID-19:
Links to the Wisconsin Department of Health Services information about COVID-19:
Link to the Wisconsin Department of Public Instruction webpage:

td.p: Several companies have announced programs to offer internet access during the COVID-19 pandemic.

As a school district, we are not promoting any one service but wanted to share the information from the Wisconsin Department of Public Instruction web page. We would anticipate a large demand so act quickly if you are interested.

div.p: Effective Monday, April 13, Woodlawn's Grab-and-Go meal distribution is moving to Peace Lutheran's Parking Lot due to road construction on Wacker Dr.

Independence Park: Vehicles will enter the East end of Independence Park off of Monroe Ave (near the mulch pile) and drive through to pick up their meals, exiting onto S. Wilson. Walkers can pick up meals near the Shelter.
Veteran's Pool: Vehicles will enter Lincoln School east parking lot off of S. Main St. and circle around the pool complex exiting onto Monroe Ave (near the skate park).

p.strong: Preordering is NOT necessary for Hartford Locations.

div.p: To preorder lunches for Erin, Friess lake and HNR visit:

ul.li: Erin School visit: Erin School Grab & Go Order Form
Friess Lake Elementary School: HHASD Grab & Go Order Form
HNR School: HNR Schools Grab & Go Order Form

p.b: Dear HUHS Students, Parents, and Guardians,
Earlier today, Wisconsin Governor Tony Evers extended the “Safer At Home” order to May 26, 2020, which can be found here. Specific to K-12 education, the order states:
“Public and private K-12 schools will remain closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year.”
This means the Hartford Union High School District remains closed and will continue with virtual learning for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year.

Students are expected to engage with their teachers regularly and complete tasks and assignments digitally. Please watch for future communication regarding any adjustments we will be making with virtual learning for the remainder of the school year, scheduled events during the closure, and plans for students to access any personal items they may still have at school.

All HUHS activities have been canceled or postponed at this time. All building use/rentals are canceled for the remainder of the school year. The WIAA will provide more information regarding spring sports seasons and summertime regulations after their April 21st Board of Control meeting. We will be sharing out additional information as it becomes available, including thoughts on Prom and our 2020 Commencement Ceremony.

Grab and Go breakfast and lunches will continue to be available for pick-up through Friday, May 29, 2020, at the designated locations. For details about the meal program as well as additional resources, please visit our website.

Please abide by the directives of our elected officials and practice social distancing, staying home if you are able. We will continue to do our part in this fight against COVID-19 and look forward to the day we can reopen our campus. Please continue to monitor your email, our social media, and the website for updates and further information. I am thinking of each of your families during this time, and wish for happier and healthier days ahead!

td.p: We have identified the following factors for a successful digital learning experience and ones you can expect from our teachers:

ul.li: Reasonable time commitment for each course
Instructional activities aligned to course learning outcomes
Opportunities for virtual collaboration, projects, etc.
Regular and authentic feedback
Graded proficiency assessments entered into Skyward
Clear communication of office hours, availability of support, and how to access learning activities
Flexibility in due dates to support individual student schedules/obligations
Follow-up on student progress and incomplete assignments
Any new learning activities or reminders will be shared with students by 8:00 am including any updates on pacing for longer-term projects

td.p: While instruction looks different, your student needs to engage and fully participate in the learning activities they are provided by teachers in order to earn their credits.

ul.li: Check teacher communication daily after 8:00 am
Complete assignments and activities assigned by teachers
Utilize teacher’s office hours provided for support
Meet all deadlines established by teachers
Take responsibility for your learning
Hartford Union High School District
805 Cedar Street, Hartford, WI 53027
